all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: Dulbecco's modified eagle medium, supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum, 5% DMSO
cooling rate: 3°C/min, 5/min, 10/min
comments about method: The cells were allowed to reach room temp so that the cryopreservant could diffuse into the cells. They were cooled down to -80C and stored in liquid nitrogen.
comments about results: Standard cyropreservation procedures do not seem to be efficient for BMMeSCs. Viability assays by flow cytometry was more sensitive. Significant cell death is due to cell shrinkage and decreased nucleus to cytoplasm ratio.

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: ADMEM containing  0.05 M glucose, 0.05 M sucrose and 1.5 M ethylene glycol and 0% FBS
cooling rate: Equilibrate at 1°C for 30 min Cool at −2°C/min to −9°C Hold at −9°C to −9.1°C for 5 min Cool at −0.3°C/min to −40°C Cool at −10°C/min to −140°C and then immediately plung into liquid nitrogen
with the cooling rate of 1 degree/min down to-80 °C with following plunging into liquid nitrogen.
comments about method: There are two main process in this experiment 1: find out the optimal concentration of crypprotectant (sucrose 200mM) through pretrement 2:compare the viability, recovery,PDT, Adipogenic differentiation and Osteogenic differentiation ability of different pretrement soultion affect on the ASCs.
comments about results: The result showed during cryopreservation, their presence only outside the cellsnhas been shown to be insufficient for obtaining satisfactory results. Sugar is required in both the intra and extracellular compartments. The optimal sucrose concentrations for the preservation of ASCs were 100 mM. In general, the presented DMSO-free/xeno-free ASCs preparation process allows preserving about 60% of cells after cryopreservation in the absence of DMSO and FS.

cooling rate: same
Directly at -80C
recovery: Reported as cell number (feeder independent) or colony number (feeder dependent)

cooling rate: Directly at -80C
recovery: Reported as cell number (feeder independent) or colony number (feeder dependent)

cooling rate: Directly at -80C
recovery: Reported as cell number (feeder independent) or colony number (feeder dependent)

cooling rate: 1°C/min  to −80°C
comments about method: trypan blue for viablity test,Von Kossa’s method for checking differentiation
comments about results: High viability and relatively low  proliferation and lose osteogenic differentiation ability

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti:
DMEM/Ham’s F-12( (1:1,; Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium: Nutrient Mixture F-12) medium (serum free) + 10% DMSO, 0.1 mol/L maltose, and
1% sericin
cooling rate: 1°C/min  to −80°C
comments about results: High viability and relatively higher  proliferation and lose  osteogenic differentiation ability

cooling rate: ~1.1°C/min to  –40°C then 0.7°C/min to  –50°C,  then 0.3°C/min  and then 0.1°C/min to  –80°C
comments about method: The viability tested was conducted by quantitative flow cytometry annexin V-FITC-negative and PI-negative; annexin V− and PI− , Oil Red O staining and Alizarin Red staining for checking adipogenic differentiation and osteogenic differentiation respectively.
comments about results: The absence of DMSO (with MC) significantly increased apoptosis and necrosis of ASC.ASCs can be frozen in serum-free DMEM containing at minimum 2% DMSO to maintain their viability and adipogenic and osteogenic differentiation capacity after thawing, providing a feasible solution for their clinical application.

comments about results: High viability (~50–65%), live cell numbers increase by 0.3–0.5 × 10^5 by day 7; good attachment; retains morphology; highest Ki67 (97.3% at 3 months), Col-1 (100%) expression

cooling rate: -1°C/min to -80°C (CoolCell container), then transferred to liquid nitrogen

comments about method: Thawing involved stepwise dilution with a solution containing 20% HS and 5% ACD.Viability assessed by flow cytometry (PI & Annexin V）
comments about results: Results showed a high post-thawing cell recovery rate 114% ± 2.90% and relatively high viability at 72.71% ± 2.12% but will keep decreasing to around 81.03% ± 4.30% and 63.02% ± 2.33% along with the time and differentiation ability haven’t showed a big impact after thawing. The result showed that MSSF (1°C/min, FS-1) is the optimal solution with highest viability (87±5%) and vitrification showed a poor result in general.

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: Equilibration Solution: 20% Ethylene Glycol (EG), 20% Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS), in DPBS
cooling rate: Vitrification: Rapid cooling by plunging into liquid nitrogen (~2500°C/min to 5000°C/min), exact rate not specified
recovery: Post-thaw: Retained fibroblast-like morphology, proliferation up to Passage 14 (30-31 doublings), maintained expression of MSC markers (CD44, CD49d, CD59, CD90, CD105, HLA-ABC) and ESC markers (Oct-4, TRA-1-60, SSEA-3, SSEA-4), differentiated into osteoblasts, adipocytes, and chondrocytes
doubling time: Post-thaw: Average 3.4 days (Passage 3 to 14), comparable to non-cryopreserved HAMs (3.3 days)
comments about method: HAMs isolated from 10 human placentas (Cesarean section) with IRB approval, treated with trypsin and collagenase/DNase, cultured in DMEM-LG with 10% FBS; vitrification with two-step exposure (20% EG for 5 min, then 40% EG + 18% Ficoll 70 + 0.3 M sucrose for 40 s), plunged into liquid nitrogen in cryovials, stored for 2 weeks, thawed in 37°C water bath with stepwise sucrose dilution; viability assessed by Trypan Blue, morphology and proliferation monitored to Passage 14, surface antigens (CD31, CD34, CD44, etc.) analyzed by flow cytometry, ESC markers (Oct-4, Nestin, etc.) by RT-PCR and immunocytochemistry, differentiation (osteogenic, adipogenic, chondrogenic) evaluated with Von Kossa, Oil Red O, and Alcian Blue staining; statistical analysis with χ² test (p<0.05).
comments about results: Vitrification yielded 84.3 ± 3.2% viability, preserving fibroblast-like morphology, proliferation (doubling time 3.4 days), and MSC/ESC marker expression (CD44, CD90, Oct-4, TRA-1-60) post-thaw; cells differentiated into osteoblasts (CBFA-1), adipocytes (LPL), and chondrocytes (Decorin) similarly to non-cryopreserved controls; EG-based solution (EFS 40) outperformed slow freezing and combinations with DMSO/PROH, with Ficoll 70 enhancing permeation; limitations include short 2-week storage and potential contamination risks from liquid nitrogen.

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: Vitrification Solution: 40% Ethylene Glycol (EG), 18% Ficoll 70, 0.3 M Sucrose, 20% FBS, in DPBS
cooling rate: Thawing: Rapid warming in 37°C water bath, exact rate not specified
recovery: Post-thaw: Retained fibroblast-like morphology, proliferation up to Passage 14 (30-31 doublings), maintained expression of MSC markers (CD44, CD49d, CD59, CD90, CD105, HLA-ABC) and ESC markers (Oct-4, TRA-1-60, SSEA-3, SSEA-4), differentiated into osteoblasts, adipocytes, and chondrocytes
doubling time: Post-thaw: Average 3.4 days (Passage 3 to 14), comparable to non-cryopreserved HAMs (3.3 days)

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: 6% Hydroxyethyl Starch, 20% DMSO, in 50 mL cell suspension (final 10% DMSO)
cooling rate: Controlled-rate freezing at -1°C/min to -80°C, then gas-phase liquid nitrogen storage
comments about method: HPC collected from 94 patients (2013–2022) via apheresis, platelet depletion, volume reduction, cryopreserved with 10% DMSO + 6% HES in EVA bags, controlled-rate freezing (MiniDigitcool), stored in gas-phase LN2; microbiological testing negative

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: 6% Hydroxyethyl Starch (1:1 dilution with thawed bag), processed via Sepax-2 S100 SmartWash program
cooling rate: Not Mentioned
recovery: CD34+ cell recovery: 75% (66–83%) (Run 1), 73% (64–79%) (Run 2); maintained functionality (CFU-GM for allogeneic grafts)
comments about method: Thawing with Smart-Max (9 min static + 1 min dynamic at 37°C), 1:1 dilution with 6% HES, Sepax-2 S100 SmartWash to concentrate 2 bags into 1 (150 mL), same day, same operator, 3–4 h interval (n=45); CD34+/CD45+ viability via flow cytometry (Stem-Kit, ISCT protocol), CFU-GM assay for allogeneic; Mann-Whitney, Bland-Altman analysis (p≤0.05, GraphPad Prism 5)
comments about results: Comparable CD34+ recovery (75% vs. 73%, p=0.54) and viability (CD34+ 78% vs. 78%, CD45+ 79% vs. 80%, p=0.85/0.59), bias near 0% (Bland-Altman); recovery linked to initial product quality

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: 6% Hydroxyethyl Starch (1:1 dilution with thawed bag), processed via Sepax-2 S100 SmartWash program
cooling rate: Not Mentioned
recovery: CD34+ cell recovery: 77% (68–85%) (Run 1), 77% (70–84%) (Run 2); maintained functionality (CFU-GM for allogeneic grafts)
comments about method: Thawing with Smart-Max (9 min static + 1 min dynamic at 37°C), 1:1 dilution with 6% HES, Sepax-2 S100 SmartWash to concentrate 2 bags into 1 (150 mL), different days, different operators (n=49); CD34+/CD45+ viability via flow cytometry (Stem-Kit, ISCT protocol), CFU-GM assay for allogeneic; Mann-Whitney, Bland-Altman analysis (p≤0.05, GraphPad Prism 5)
comments about results: Comparable CD34+ recovery (77% vs. 77%, p=0.74) and viability (CD34+ 84% vs. 85%, CD45+ 79% vs. 78%, p=0.95/0.69), bias near 0% (Bland-Altman); recovery linked to initial product quality

all ingredients in cryoprotective soluti: 10% Glycerol, 2:1 DMEM/HAM F12, 10% FBS, 4 mM L-glutamine, 50 μg/mL penicillin-streptomycin, 5 μg/mL insulin, 0.4 μg/mL hydrocortisone, 0.18 mM adenine, 8.1 μg/mL cholera toxin, 2 nM triiodothyronine, 10 ng/mL EGF
cooling rate: Slow rate-controlled cooling using isopropanol freezing container (Mr. Frosty) to -20°C for 24h, then liquid nitrogen
recovery: Maintained clonogenic capacity (CFE 17.0% ± 0.1% clonogenic, 3.6% ± 1.2% abortive), proliferative capacity (CCD 45 ± 7.6 doublings), and differentiation (p63α 33.1% ± 21.7% at P3, 21.0% ± 7.0% at P5; K19 63.8% ± 17.9% at P3, 65.5% ± 12.3% at P5)
comments about method: Conjunctival cells from 3 cadaveric donors (36–79 years) isolated by trypsin/EDTA, cultured on 3T3-J2 feeder layer, cryopreserved in 0.5 mL 10% glycerol solution with culture medium, slow cooling (Mr. Frosty) to -20°C for 24h then liquid nitrogen for 30 days; viability by trypan blue, quality tests (CFE, CCD, immunohistochemistry) over 6 passages; statistical analysis with two-tailed t-test (p<0.05, SPSS v24)
comments about results: Viability 60.6% ± 7.9%, lower than DMSO (p=0.001); maintained proliferative (CCD 45 ± 7.6), clonogenic (CFE 17.0% ± 0.1%), and differentiation capacity (p63α, K19 unchanged, p≥0.05)

Post thaw, the cells were counted using trypan blue staining.  The cell recovery values at 24 h after plating were calculated by multiplying cell recovery after thawing and optical density at 450 nm at 24 h after plating
comments about results: the PEG−PA (5000−500) block copolymer is suggested to be a promising antifreezing cryoprotectant for stem cells
